div.p: A required child element of address used for recording one line of a postal or other address.

list.label: addressLineType
list.item:
Optional
(values limited to: county, country, district, municipality, postBox, postalCode, region, street)
list.label: audience
conventionDeclarationReference
id
languageOfElement
localType
localTypeDeclarationReference
maintenanceEventReference
scriptOfElement
sourceReference
target

div.p: addressLine is used to encode parts or lines of a physical address within a parent address element.
addressLine may be repeated as many times as necessary to enter all parts of an address.
Use the optional addressLineType attribute to encode the part of the address that the addressLine refers to, for example "street".

div.egXML: <address> <addressLine languageOfElement="se">Kungl. Hovstaterna</addressLine> <addressLine languageOfElement="se">Kungl. Slottet</addressLine> <addressLine addressLineType="postalCode">10770</addressLine> <addressLine languageOfElement="se" addressLineType="municipality">Stockholm</addressLine> <addressLine languageOfElement="se" addressLineType="country">Sverige</addressLine> <addressLine languageOfElement="en" addressLineType="country">Sweden</addressLine> </address>
